title: Academic Research Fieldwork Weather Risk Forecaster
description: Input your field site coordinates, scheduled fieldwork dates, activity types, equipment sensitivity profiles, and team availability to receive a tailored weather risk forecast with basic scheduling suggestions and contingency recommendations to help plan safe and effective academic field research.
inputLabel: Enter project details in JSON or upload a JSON file containing field site coordinates, scheduled field activities, equipment sensitivity profiles, and team availability.
outputLabel: Weather risk forecast, alerts, and basic scheduling recommendations
systemPrompt: You are a specialized assistant for academic field research project managers. Given the project details including site geolocation coordinates, scheduled fieldwork dates and activity types, equipment sensitivity profiles, and team availability, generate a tailored weather risk forecast for the scheduled field activities. Provide clear probabilistic risk summaries, alerts for high-risk weather windows, and basic scheduling suggestions to mitigate weather risks. Include advisory contingency recommendations such as backup equipment or safety protocols. Refuse to provide any medical or safety-critical decisions. Validate all inputs for correctness and completeness. If inputs are missing or invalid, respond with a clear error message and do not proceed. Output must be plain text by default; if structured-output feature is enabled, provide a valid JSON object with forecast details. Always communicate forecast uncertainty clearly to avoid overconfidence.

presets.label: Basic Risk Forecast
presets.prompt: Analyze the provided project details and return a tailored weather risk forecast with alerts and simple scheduling suggestions.

presets.label: Detailed Contingency Plan
presets.prompt: Generate a detailed contingency plan including backup equipment recommendations and safety protocols based on the weather risk forecast.

presets.label: Scheduling Optimization Suggestions
presets.prompt: Provide optimized scheduling suggestions considering weather risks, equipment sensitivity, and team availability.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured output enabled, respond with JSON containing keys: fieldActivityId, riskScore (0-1), riskSummary, alerts (array), schedulingSuggestions, contingencyRecommendations, advisoryNotes.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide complete project details including site coordinates, scheduled field activities with dates and types, equipment sensitivity profiles, and team availability. Ensure all inputs are valid and correctly formatted.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated weather risk forecast and scheduling suggestions. Confirm if you want to save or refine your input data for more accurate results.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Fieldwork Weather Risk Forecaster

niche.scenario: Planning and managing outdoor field research activities with variable weather conditions

idea.problem: Academic field research teams often face unexpected weather disruptions that cause delays, damage equipment, or compromise data quality. Current tools track logistics and equipment but lack integrated, project-specific weather risk forecasting that can inform proactive scheduling and contingency planning.
inputs: Scheduled fieldwork dates and activity types
Historical weather data or local climate profiles
Critical equipment sensitivity profiles (e.g., temperature/humidity limits)
Research team availability and travel plans
outputs: Tailored weather risk forecasts for each scheduled field activity
Alerts for high-risk weather windows affecting critical tasks or equipment
Optimized fieldwork schedule with alternative dates to mitigate weather risks
Contingency planning recommendations (e.g., backup equipment, safety protocols)
Visual timeline integrating weather risks with logistics and compliance milestones
whyItWins: Integrates weather risk forecasting directly into academic fieldwork management workflow
Provides actionable, tailored scheduling and contingency guidance beyond generic weather reports
Supports repeated updates and refinements as project plans evolve and new data arrives
Improves resource utilization, safety, and data quality by anticipating weather disruptions
Fills a critical gap not addressed by existing fieldwork logistics or equipment tracking tools

upgradePath.today: A lightweight single-page app where users input site coordinates, dates, and equipment sensitivity to receive a simple weather risk report with basic scheduling suggestions
upgradePath.in90Days: Add integration with live weather APIs for dynamic risk updates, user accounts for saving multiple projects, and calendar export features for fieldwork schedules
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a multi-page system with collaborative team access, detailed weather event simulations, integrated equipment and compliance tracking, mobile alerts, and machine learning-powered predictive scheduling optimization

riskNotes: Must ensure no reliance on precise medical or safety-critical decisions solely from forecasts; provide advisory recommendations only
Respect user privacy and data security when handling location and project data
Weather forecasts inherently uncertain; communicate probabilistic risk clearly to avoid overconfidence
Avoid overcomplexity that impedes ease of use for busy field researchers

blueprint.summary: A multi-page application designed to help academic field research project managers integrate tailored weather risk forecasting into their fieldwork planning and management. It provides actionable scheduling guidance, contingency recommendations, and visual timelines to mitigate weather-related disruptions.
successMetrics: Reduction in weather-related fieldwork delays or cancellations
User adoption rate and frequency of project updates
Accuracy and usefulness of weather risk forecasts and scheduling suggestions
User satisfaction with contingency planning recommendations
Engagement with visual timeline and alert features

components.name: Dashboard UI
components.responsibility: Provide an overview of projects, upcoming field activities, weather risk summaries, and alerts.
notes: Must be responsive and prioritize clarity for busy users
Show probabilistic risk visually and clearly

components.name: Project & Schedule Management UI
components.responsibility: Allow users to input and update project details including site coordinates, fieldwork dates, activity types, equipment profiles, and team availability.
notes: Support incremental updates to plans
Validate inputs for geolocation and date ranges

components.name: Weather Risk Reporting UI
components.responsibility: Display detailed weather risk forecasts, alerts, contingency recommendations, and optimized scheduling suggestions.
notes: Communicate uncertainty clearly
Include visual timeline integrating weather risks with logistics

components.name: Project Management API
components.responsibility: Handle CRUD operations for projects, field activities, equipment profiles, and team availability data.
notes: Ensure data privacy and secure access controls
Support multi-project and multi-user scenarios

components.name: Weather Risk Forecasting API
components.responsibility: Generate tailored weather risk forecasts based on project inputs, historical data, and live weather API integration.
notes: Provide probabilistic risk scores and advisory recommendations
Update forecasts dynamically as new data arrives

components.name: Scheduling Optimization API
components.responsibility: Produce optimized fieldwork schedules and alternative dates to mitigate weather risks, including contingency planning suggestions.
notes: Incorporate equipment sensitivity and team availability constraints
Allow repeated refinements as plans evolve

components.name: Project Data Store
components.responsibility: Persist project metadata, field activity schedules, equipment sensitivity profiles, and team availability.
notes: Encrypted storage for sensitive location and personnel data
Support versioning or history for plan updates

components.name: Weather Risk Data Store
components.responsibility: Store historical weather data, cached forecast results, and risk assessment outputs for projects.
notes: Cache results to optimize performance
Track forecast timestamps and data sources

components.name: External Weather API Integration
components.responsibility: Fetch live weather data and historical climate profiles from third-party weather service providers.
notes: Handle API rate limits and failures gracefully
Normalize data formats for internal processing

components.name: Periodic Forecast Update Job
components.responsibility: Trigger scheduled updates of weather risk forecasts for active projects to keep risk assessments current.
notes: Run at configurable intervals (e.g., daily or hourly)
Notify users of significant risk changes

dataModels.name: Project
dataModels.purpose: Represents an academic field research project with associated field activities and metadata.

dataModels.name: FieldActivity
dataModels.purpose: Scheduled fieldwork activity with location, dates, and activity type.

dataModels.name: EquipmentProfile
dataModels.purpose: Defines equipment sensitivity limits relevant to weather conditions.

dataModels.name: TeamAvailability
dataModels.purpose: Tracks availability and travel plans of research team members.

dataModels.name: WeatherRiskForecast
dataModels.purpose: Stores weather risk forecast results and advisory notes for field activities.

pages.title: Project Dashboard
pages.purpose: Overview of all projects, upcoming activities, weather risk summaries, and alerts.

pages.title: Create New Project
pages.purpose: Form to create a new research project with initial field activities and equipment profiles.

pages.title: Edit Project
pages.purpose: Edit project details, field schedules, equipment profiles, and team availability.

pages.title: Weather Risk Report
pages.purpose: Display detailed weather risk forecasts, contingency recommendations, and optimized schedules for a project.

pages.title: User Login
pages.purpose: Authenticate users to access their projects and data.

apiRoutes.purpose: Retrieve list of projects for authenticated user.
Create a new project with initial data.
apiRoutes.requestShape: Project metadata, field activities, equipment profiles

apiRoutes.purpose: Update existing project details and related data.
apiRoutes.requestShape: Updated project metadata and related entities

apiRoutes.purpose: Fetch latest weather risk forecast for a specific field activity.
Get optimized scheduling suggestions for a project based on weather risk and constraints.

backgroundJobs.name: Periodic Forecast Update
backgroundJobs.purpose: Refresh weather risk forecasts for active field activities and notify users of significant changes.

edgeCases: Handling incomplete or invalid geolocation inputs gracefully with user feedback.
Dealing with missing or outdated historical weather data by falling back to climate profiles.
Managing API failures or rate limits from external weather services with retries and cached data.
Communicating forecast uncertainty clearly to prevent overconfidence in scheduling decisions.
Supporting overlapping or conflicting team availability and equipment constraints in scheduling.
Ensuring data privacy and secure access when multiple users access shared projects.
Handling daylight saving time or timezone differences in scheduling and date inputs.
nonGoals: Providing medical or safety-critical decision making based solely on weather forecasts.
Replacing comprehensive field logistics or equipment tracking systems.
Offering real-time weather monitoring or emergency alerting beyond advisory notifications.
Supporting non-academic or non-fieldwork use cases.
Building complex machine learning models beyond basic scheduling optimization in initial phases.

dataFlow: User authenticates via /login page, receives session token for API access.
Dashboard page fetches project summaries, upcoming activities, and weather risk alerts from /api/projects and /api/weather-risk endpoints.
Project creation page submits new project metadata, field activities, and equipment profiles to POST /api/projects.
Project edit page loads existing project data via GET /api/projects, allows incremental updates, then submits changes via POST /api/projects/:projectId.
Weather risk report page fetches detailed weather risk forecasts from GET /api/weather-risk/:fieldActivityId and scheduling suggestions from GET /api/scheduling/:projectId.
Scheduling API integrates weather risk data, equipment constraints, and team availability to generate optimized schedules and contingency plans.
External weather API integration fetches live and historical weather data, normalizes it, and caches results in WeatherRisk data store.
Periodic background job triggers weather risk forecast updates for active projects, updates data store, and notifies users of significant risk changes.
All data flows enforce user authentication and authorization to ensure data privacy and multi-user access control.
validationRules: Project name: required, non-empty string, max length 255.
FieldActivity siteCoordinates: required JSON object with valid latitude (-90 to 90) and longitude (-180 to 180).
FieldActivity startDate and endDate: required dates, startDate <= endDate, dates must be valid ISO 8601 format.
ActivityType: required string, must be from predefined allowed activity types list.
EquipmentProfile temperatureLimit and humidityLimit: optional JSON with numeric min/max values, if present must be valid ranges.
TeamAvailability availableDates: required JSON array of date ranges, each with valid start and end dates, no overlaps.
API endpoints require authenticated user context; project and related data must belong to the requesting user or their authorized projects.
Incremental updates must validate partial inputs and reject invalid or inconsistent data.
Date inputs must handle timezone offsets and daylight saving time correctly.
Login inputs: username and password required, non-empty strings.
Scheduling API input constraints: equipment sensitivity and team availability must be respected in optimization logic.
errorHandling: API endpoints return 401 Unauthorized if user is not authenticated.
API endpoints return 403 Forbidden if user attempts to access or modify projects they do not own or have access to.
Validation errors return 400 Bad Request with detailed error messages specifying invalid fields.
External weather API failures trigger retries with exponential backoff; if persistent, fallback to cached historical data.
Rate limit errors from external APIs are handled gracefully by queuing requests or delaying calls.
Missing or incomplete geolocation inputs cause UI validation errors with user-friendly messages prompting correction.
Background job logs errors and alerts system admins on repeated failures; does not block user operations.
API responses include error codes and human-readable messages for client-side display.
Uncaught exceptions return 500 Internal Server Error with generic message; detailed logs kept server-side.
Date parsing errors return validation errors with guidance on correct format.
securityNotes: All API routes require authentication except /login.
Use secure HTTP-only cookies or JWT tokens for session management.
Enforce authorization checks on all project-related data access to prevent data leaks.
Encrypt sensitive fields such as siteCoordinates and personnel data at rest in the database.
Sanitize all inputs to prevent injection attacks.
Limit rate of API calls per user to prevent abuse.
Use HTTPS for all client-server and server-server communications.
Store external API keys securely in environment variables, not in source code.
Log access and modification events for audit trails.
Implement CORS policies to restrict API access to authorized frontends.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on the /dashboard page with multiple projects
acceptanceTests.then: The user sees a summary list of their projects, upcoming field activities, and current weather risk alerts with clear probabilistic visuals

acceptanceTests.when: They submit a new project form with valid project metadata, field activities, and equipment profiles
acceptanceTests.then: The project is created successfully, stored in the database, and the user receives a confirmation message

acceptanceTests.given: A user editing an existing project on /projects/:projectId/edit
acceptanceTests.when: They update field activity dates with invalid geolocation data
acceptanceTests.then: The system rejects the update with a validation error indicating the geolocation issue

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests weather risk forecast for a field activity via /api/weather-risk/:fieldActivityId
acceptanceTests.when: The external weather API is temporarily unavailable
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns the most recent cached forecast data with a warning about data freshness

acceptanceTests.given: A user requests optimized scheduling suggestions for a project via /api/scheduling/:projectId
acceptanceTests.when: The project has overlapping team availability and equipment constraints
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns a schedule that respects constraints and includes contingency recommendations

acceptanceTests.given: A background job runs the periodic forecast update
acceptanceTests.when: Significant changes in weather risk are detected for active projects
acceptanceTests.then: The system updates forecasts in the data store and sends notifications to affected users

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /dashboard or any project API
acceptanceTests.then: The system responds with 401 Unauthorized and redirects to /login if applicable

acceptanceTests.given: A user inputs dates with timezone differences and daylight saving time changes
acceptanceTests.when: They save or update project schedules
acceptanceTests.then: The system correctly stores and displays dates respecting timezone and DST adjustments

buildOrder: Set up Prisma data models for Project, FieldActivity, EquipmentProfile, TeamAvailability, WeatherRiskForecast
Develop API routes for /api/projects with GET, POST, and POST/:projectId including validation and authorization
Create UI pages for /projects/new and /projects/:projectId/edit with forms and validation
Integrate external weather API with normalization and caching in data-weather-risk store
Implement /api/weather-risk/:fieldActivityId GET endpoint to fetch and serve forecasts
Build /api/scheduling/:projectId GET endpoint for optimized scheduling logic
Develop /dashboard page to display project summaries, upcoming activities, and risk alerts
Create /projects/:projectId/risk-report page to show detailed weather risk and scheduling suggestions
Implement background job for periodic forecast updates and user notifications
Add comprehensive error handling, logging, and security enforcement across all layers
Conduct acceptance testing and fix issues

prismaModelsToAdd: model Project { id String @id @default(uuid()) name String description String? createdAt DateTime updatedAt DateTime fieldActivities FieldActivity[] equipmentProfiles EquipmentProfile[] teamAvailabilities TeamAvailability[] }

model FieldActivity { id String @id @default(uuid()) projectId String siteCoordinates Json startDate DateTime endDate DateTime activityType String notes String? project Project @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id]) weatherRiskForecasts WeatherRiskForecast[] }

model EquipmentProfile { id String @id @default(uuid()) projectId String equipmentName String temperatureLimit Json? humidityLimit Json? otherConstraints Json? project Project @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id]) }
model TeamAvailability { id String @id @default(uuid()) projectId String memberName String availableDates Json project Project @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id]) }

model WeatherRiskForecast { id String @id @default(uuid()) fieldActivityId String forecastDate DateTime riskScore Float riskDetails Json advisoryNotes String? lastUpdated DateTime fieldActivity FieldActivity @relation(fields: [fieldActivityId], references: [id]) }

nextPrompts.title: Planner: refine requirements
nextPrompts.purpose: Ask for any missing constraints, user preferences, or edge cases regarding academic fieldwork weather risk forecasting and scheduling.
nextPrompts.promptTemplate: Given the current blueprint and expanded specs: {{BLUEPRINT}} {{EXPANDED}}, please provide additional constraints, preferences, or details missing from the project requirements to improve the weather risk forecasting tool. User input: {{USER_INPUT}}

nextPrompts.title: Architect: finalize pages + data models
nextPrompts.purpose: Define and finalize the UI pages, API endpoints, and data models needed to implement the academic fieldwork weather risk forecaster.
nextPrompts.promptTemplate: Using the idea spec and blueprint: {{IDEA}}, {{BLUEPRINT}}, plus expansions: {{EXPANDED}}, produce a detailed design of pages, data models, and APIs to implement the project. User input: {{USER_INPUT}}

nextPrompts.title: Builder: generate page stubs
nextPrompts.purpose: Create scaffold code and page stubs for the planned UI pages for the academic fieldwork weather risk forecaster.
nextPrompts.promptTemplate: Based on the finalized design documents: {{BLUEPRINT}}, {{EXPANDED}}, generate code stubs and scaffolds for the UI pages and forms of the project. User input: {{USER_INPUT}}

nextPrompts.title: Integrator: wire pages -> API -> DB
nextPrompts.purpose: Connect the UI pages to backend APIs and the database, ensuring data flow and security for the weather risk forecasting tool.
nextPrompts.promptTemplate: Given the scaffolded UI and API designs: {{BLUEPRINT}}, {{EXPANDED}}, integrate all components to enable data flow from UI input through APIs to database storage and back. Ensure security and validation. User input: {{USER_INPUT}}
